intro: Ibervillea millspaughii, commonly known as the Texas milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweeds and related species. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine, soft hairs. The plant contains toxic alkaloids, which serve as a defense mechanism against herbivores.
